p: For everyone else, if they were just walking down the street, protecting themselves in such situations is not as important as the above examples from an epidemiological point of view. It is much more important, however, that someone who is infected but has no symptoms does not go on to infect others. Since we cannot know who is infected until they present with symptoms, it is reasonable for everyone to cover up their mouth and nose in some way so as not to inadvertently spread the infection to others.
